threads.com:
/vmg/ is a place to discuss all types of mobile games, including both Android and iOS, phones and tablets. Please note that Nintendo and Sony handhelds are considered consoles, and that threads pertaining to those platforms and their gaming titles should be posted elsewhere.

Does this mean discussion of mobile games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vmg/ is just a separate board specifically focused on mobile games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vmg/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

last_replies.com:
>>1064111
You are still insistent despite providing no screenshots or examples, just "it didn't work for you in 4.1".
So here, as you said I tested it in score attack. You can see the stats for the 3 characters, this is on level 100.
Yuina does a CONx2 attack, so the effective defenses are the following:
Yuina: 383
Ruka: 353
Tama: 290 (exactly at border)
Each has the same starting DP, 3004. I ran 3 damage tests and you can see that every single time, Yuina took the least damage, then Ruka, then Tama. Further, look here for the enemy stats:
https://www.seraph.day/enemies/Enemy_YShirakawa_scoreattack_d
AoE min damage is 350, multiplied by 3.2 because it's level 100. So 1120 damage, which if you subtract from 3004 is 1884 leftover DP before RNG. Notice how that's really close to Tama's DP?
If you want to assert anything else (including "it's inconsistent") then provide screenshots and evidence.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1064111
Damage reduction does occur with stats past the border. Pic is my team's damage at Level 30 with everyone's defense at around 320. The Effect Parameter Cap is what determines the necessary stats needed to reduce the damage to 1, but with Score Attack it's not as straight forward. Since the border and stats don't change between SA Level 1 and Level 30, that means the Effect Parameter Cap is what changes between levels, which is why my team takes >1 damage from attacks, but it's not the roughly 350/800 you're implying I would be taking. I can go up to around level 12 before I start taking more than 1 damage.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1064111
>>1064128
To expand on this from my personal observations: There seems to be 2 different scaling calculations for damage taken. The main one is the scale used for below border to border, where meeting the border drops the damage to the minimum damage for the enemy's attack, +/- RNG variation. The second scale is used for above border stats and reduces the minimum damage even further as you approach the Effect Parameter Cap. Most of the time for harder enemies, the Effect Parameter Cap is so large that it's unfeasible for current teams to reach it and reduce damage to 1, which would be why you have the impression that stats above the border don't do anything, even though it absolutely does.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1063684
Calculating rolls is hard.
First of all, never roll in any banner with less than 60 rolls on hand, that's how much it takes to get a hard pity 6* even as a lucklet (most people get it around 50 rolls).
But this just means you get a 6*, rate up is another matter.
This means you will want 120 rolls when going into any banner for at least 2 tries.
However given the rates are decent, you may get the rate up 6* before even hitting 60 rolls.
But because rate up is still down to chance, you may not get them even after dumping 250 rolls into the banner.
It's tricky, try to not plan for more than 2 ops at once as a f2p, if you get lucky then that's great, if not then at least you got what you planned for.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1063572
C-congratulations.
There's some single player quests you can grind for pots(not really efficient without drop increase characters), and co-op quests which is where most people do it. It's called inheritance zone. Raids also give some pots.
The trick is that a lot of people are going to only want to co-op with groups of the characters who boost the number of pots you get per run, but as a new player, having you in the group gives them points so you can probably get into carry groups in raids that are demanding bonus units, pot characters, OR new players.
As far as which characters have the potion drop skill, you can filter by skill here: https://bbs-simulator.com/characters
For example, the blue units with potion skills are christmas Momo, swimsuit Unohana, white day Grimmjow, christmas Noel, Akon, and Hanataro.
It's really handy to have one of each color to make it easy to co-op farm pots, but not 100% necessary with the new player tag. The voted lineup banner later this month will probably have at least a few, haven't checked which units won.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1063575
What are pots for and how important is it to have a pot drop unit

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1063580
Pot units are for pot farming. They increase the amount of possible potions per run.
You need potions to level up your link slots, so it's pretty damn important to have one of each colour since people will likely kick you out of rooms if you show up without one.
Keep in mind that super pots are not the same as pots, but you will need super pots to get your character's link slot level past 10. And to farm super pots you need super pot units.

Just look at your album and filter the skills increase super/link slot potions to find out who you should be aiming for.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1063580
Pots level up your link slots
Link slots are three slots each character has where they can pass a skill down from another character
Usually this is just increased damage, or less cooldown on your strong attacks
Leveling up the slots gives you not only the skill but a percentage of the linked character’s stats when you match attributes

Are link slot characters important? Very. But a fair amount of them are premium AKA not limited meaning you’ll get them eventually so don’t waste orbs pulling for them

>>1063982
Depends how far you are in the game.
Go ahead and do the latest chapter. Assuming you’re past level 64, go and grind for Twilight equipment.

Get an armor, headgear and weapon for each person (defeat the regular enemies in the Sufrataljah region).

Next, try to forge all your Twilight weapons to Twilight III weapons. You can get the materials by killing the four elite enemies in the Sufrataljah Palace.

This last part will take you DAYS to accomplish. Just remember that the Silver Wind Sentry and the Warrior respawn every 10 hours while the Golden Guardian and the Golden Curator respawn every 20 hours. Rinse and repeat until all 8 of your party members have Twilight III weapons.

You should have some decent levels under your belt.

>actually requires thinking, isn't just pointless clicking
>complex game mechanics disguised with affable and adorable, albeit minimalist graphics
>highly competitive multiplayer
>despite playing against real people, the game is divided into short matches, which means you can leave your run and pick it back up whenever you want, making it perfect for playing on the bus and such
>infinite combinations and possibilities
>new animal packs come out weekly, so the game never gets boring
>only form of monetization being some funny hats and an animal pack, which doesnt give you unfair advantage, but is rather a form of dlc
>many funny subtle details you notice as you play (for example giraffe sound effect being just tts saying 'giraffe' or weaker pets visibly sweating when you grab the euthanasia pill)
